greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Number of Ramanujan primes R_k between triangular numbers T(n-1) < R_k <= T(n).
comment: The function eta(x), A191228, returns the greatest value of k of R_k <= x, and where R_k is the k-th Ramanujan prime (A104272).
link: T. D. Noe, Table of n, a(n) for n = 1..10000
J. Sondow, J. W. Nicholson, and T. D. Noe, Ramanujan Primes: Bounds, Runs, Twins, and Gaps, J. Integer Seq. 14 (2011) Article 11.6.2
example: Write the numbers 1, 2, ... in a triangle with n terms in the n-th row; a(n) = number of Ramanujan primes in n-th row.
mathematica: terms = 100; nn = terms^2; R = Table[0, {nn}]; s = 0;
Do[If[PrimeQ[k], s++]; If[PrimeQ[k/2], s--]; If[s < nn, R[[s+1]] = k], {k, Prime[3 nn]}];
Array[a, terms] (* _Jean-François Alcover_, Nov 07 2018, using _T. D. Noe_'s code for A104272 *)
program: (Perl) use ntheory ":all"; sub a191225 { my $n = shift; ramanujan_prime_count( (($n-1)*$n)/2+1, ($n*($n+1))/2 ); } say a191225($_) for 1..10; # _Dana Jacobsen_, Dec 30 2015
results.author: _John W. Nicholson_, May 27 2011
